p: In another study, 2α-methyl-2β-ethylene-3β-isopropyl-cyclohexan-1β, 3α-diol and phenol-O-β-D-arabinopyranosyl-4′-(3″, 7″, 11″, 15″-tetramethyl)-hexadecan-1″-oate was isolated from the fruits of Z. armatum and found anti-inflammatory properties in vitro [ 72]. In the same study, macrophages from mice were stimulated by bacterial LPS and production of pro-inflammatory cytokines (TNF-α and IL-6) was significantly inhibited by these compounds.
